org.pac4j.core.client

Interface Client<C extends Credentials,U extends UserProfile>

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    BaseClient, BaseHttpClient, BaseOAuth10Client, BaseOAuth20Client, BaseOAuthClient, BaseOpenIdClient, BasicAuthClient, CasClient, CasOAuthWrapperClient, CasProxyReceptor, DropBoxClient, FacebookClient, FormClient, FoursquareClient, GitHubClient, Google2Client, GoogleOpenIdClient, LinkedIn2Client, LinkedInClient, PayPalClient, Saml2Client, TwitterClient, VkClient, WindowsLiveClient, WordPressClient, YahooClient

    public interface Client<C extends Credentials,U extends UserProfile>
    This interface represents a client (whatever the protocol).

    A client has a type accessible by the getName() method.
    A client supports the authentication process and user profile retrieval through :
    • the redirect(WebContext, boolean, boolean) method to get the redirection to perform for the user to start the authentication (at the provider)
    • the getCredentials(WebContext) method to get the credentials (in the application) after the user has been successfully authenticated at the provider
    • the getUserProfile(Credentials, WebContext) method to get the user profile from the credentials.
    Since:
    1.4.0
    Author:
    Jerome Leleu

    • Method Summary

    • Method Detail

      • getName

        String getName()
        Get the name of the client.
        Returns:
        the name of the client

      • redirect

        void redirect(WebContext context,
            boolean protectedTarget,
            boolean ajaxRequest)
              throws RequiresHttpAction
        Redirect to the authentication provider by updating the WebContext accordingly.

        Though, if this client requires an indirect redirection, it will return a redirection to the callback url (with an additionnal parameter requesting a redirection). Whatever the kind of client's redirection, the protectedTarget parameter set to true enforces a direct redirection.

        If an authentication has already been tried for this client and has failed (previous null credentials) and if the target is protected (protectedTarget set to true), a forbidden response (403 HTTP status code) is returned.

        If the request is an AJAX one (ajaxRequest parameter set to true), an authorized response (401 HTTP status code) is returned instead of a redirection.

        Parameters:
        context -
        protectedTarget -
        ajaxRequest -
        Throws:
        RequiresHttpAction

      • getCredentials

        C getCredentials(WebContext context)
                                     throws RequiresHttpAction
        Get the credentials from the web context. In some cases, a RequiresHttpAction may be thrown instead:
        • if this client requires an indirect redirection, the redirection will be actually performed by these method and not by the #getRedirection(WebContext, boolean, boolean) one (302 HTTP status code)
        • if the CasClient receives a logout request, it returns a 200 HTTP status code
        • for the BasicAuthClient, if no credentials are sent to the callback url, an unauthorized response (401 HTTP status code) is returned to request credentials through a popup.
        Parameters:
        context -
        Returns:
        the credentials
        Throws:
        RequiresHttpAction

      • getUserProfile

        U getUserProfile(C credentials,
               WebContext context)
        Get the user profile from the credentials.
        Parameters:
        credentials -
        context -
        Returns:
        the user profile
